literature.title: Dutch pharmacogenetics working group guideline for the gene-drug interaction of ABCG2, HLA-B and Allopurinol, and MTHFR, folic acid and methotrexate.

summaryMarkdown.html: There are currently no recommendations for folic acid dosing based on MTHFR rs1801133 genotypes.

textMarkdown.html:
Dutch pharmacogenetics working group (DPWG) guideline for the gene-drug interaction of ABCG2, HLA-B and Allopurinol, and MTHFR, folic acid and methotrexate. European journal of human genetics (2022)

The Royal Dutch Pharmacists Association - Pharmacogenetics Working Group published a paper which reiterates that no action is required for the interaction between MTHFR and folic acid [Article:36056234]

May 2021 Guideline

The Royal Dutch Pharmacists Association - Pharmacogenetics Working Group has evaluated therapeutic dose recommendations for foliumzuur and MTHFR rs1801133 (677C>T) variant. They conclude that NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction. 677CT has no effect on the treatment with folic acid and 677TT either has no effect or a positive effect on the treatment with folic acid. (see Dutch guidelines May 2021 update).

Read for more information about this recommendation, Read about gene information from DPWG
